articles.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola says influential midfielder Kevin de Bruyne will stay at the club.
articles.title: Man City: Pep Guardiola says Kevin de Bruyne will not leave

articles.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta says the club are trying to strengthen "certain positions" as they close in on the signing of Italy defender Riccardo Calafiori.
articles.title: Riccardo Calafiori: Arsenal near deal for Italian defender with Mikel Arteta looking to strengthen

articles.description: LeBron James scores 20 points for the United States as they beat Germany 92-88 in their final warm-up game before the Olympics.
articles.title: LeBron James inspires USA to win against Germany in final Olympics warm-up game

articles.description: A convicted rapist would not be picked for the Australian Olympics team, says chief Anna Meares after Steven van de Velde was selected by the Netherlands.
articles.title: Olympics 2024: Australia would not pick convicted rapist Steven van de Velde, says team chief

articles.description: Aston Villa sign Everton midfielder Amadou Onana in a £50m deal.
articles.title: Amadou Onana: Aston Villa seal £50m deal for Everton midfielder

articles.description: New Manchester United signing Leny Yoro says a call from former defender Rio Ferdinand persuaded him to join the club over other suitors.
articles.title: Leny Yoro: Manchester United legend Rio Ferdinand call helped French defender choose club

articles.description: Tour de France winner Tadej Pogacar pulls out of Slovenia's team for the Olympic Games in Paris because of "extreme fatigue".
articles.title: Tadej Pogacar: Tour de France winner withdraws from Olympics because of extreme fatigue

articles.description: The 152nd Open should be remembered as a classic, writes BBC golf correspondent Iain Carter.
articles.title: Xander Schauffele: American passes ultimate examination to win at Royal Troon

articles.description: Manchester City are weighing up an Eberechi Eze move, PSG are interested in a Manchester United duo, Aston Villa target Atletico Madrid forward Joao Felix, plus more.
articles.title: Football gossip: Eze, De Bruyne, Sancho, Fernandes, Felix, Howe, Richarlison, Osimhen

articles.description: A tweak to Bazball makes England a more dangerous side and there were encouraging signs in the win over West Indies in the second Test, writes Jonathan Agnew.
articles.title: England vs West Indies: Bazball V2 shown in second Test makes hosts more dangerous - Jonathan Agnew
